page.title: 01GENERAL OUTLINE
page.content: The village of Dallington is the only area of habitation within our chosen area.Dallington is a small Wealden village approximately 500 feet above sea level.There are about 220 people on the electoral rollwith a large element of elderly inhabitants.Before the Norman Conquest it was called Deallantum meaning the enclosure of Dealla's people.It is a typical Sussex village,being one long street.The B2096 is the only "main" road crossing the block.It links Dallington with the market towns of Battle( 7milesS.E.)and Heathfield (6 miles N.W.).Traffic flow through the area is low,but contains a high proportion of Heavy Goods Vehicles and farm vehicles.The whole area is given over mainly to dairy and arable farming and there are large areas of coniferous and deciduous forests.The soil is mainly clay .
